bioghist.p: The William J. Cooper Foundation was established to provide a varied program of lectures, performances and exhibitions which enriches the academic work of Swarthmore College. The Foundation was established by a gift from William J. Cooper (1849-1925). Cooper's wife, Emma McIlvain, was a manager at Swarthmore for many years. Cooper specified that the income from his gift should be used "in bringing to the college eminent citizens of this and other countries who are leaders in statesmanship, education, the arts, sciences, learned professions and business." Past chairmen of the Cooper Foundation have included Willis D. Weatherford, Peter Grams Swing, and Thomas Blackburn.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the records of the William J. Cooper Foundation from 1943 to 1974. Materials include: correspondence with speakers and artists; financial records and artist contracts; announcements and programs; copies of lectures, some in draft form; and minutes of meetings, proposals for events, and correspondence among committee members.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
